org.spongepowered.api.world

Interface ChunkTicketManager.LoadingTicket

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ChunkTicketManager.EntityLoadingTicket, ChunkTicketManager.PlayerEntityLoadingTicket, ChunkTicketManager.PlayerLoadingTicket
    Enclosing interface:
    ChunkTicketManager

    public static interface ChunkTicketManager.LoadingTicket
    Represents a handle which allows you to force a set of chunks to remain loaded.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      Reorders a chunk to count as the 'newest' loaded chunk, making it the last chunk to be removed when adding more chunks for force-loading.

    • Method Detail

      • setNumChunks

        boolean setNumChunks(int numChunks)
        Sets the number of chunks this ticket will load at once.
        Parameters:
        numChunks - The number of chunks this ticket can load at once
        Returns:
        True if successful, false if the number of chunks is above the maximum allowed for this ticket

      • getNumChunks

        int getNumChunks()
        Gets the number of chunks this ticket can load at once.
        Returns:
        The number of possible concurrently loaded chunks

      • getMaxNumChunks

        int getMaxNumChunks()
        Gets the maximum limit on the number of concurrently loaded chunks this ticket can have.
        Returns:
        The maximum allowed concurrently loaded chunks

      • getWorld

        World getWorld()
        Gets the World passed when creating this ticket.
        Returns:
        The World object given to this ticket upon its creation

      • getCompanionData

        DataContainer getCompanionData()
        Gets the companion data stored in a DataContainer. Note that the provided DataContainer is modifiable, but a copy of the internal container, and as such may need to be setCompanionData(DataContainer) before modifications can be handled.

        The sort of data stored in the container is plugin/mod dependent and is based on the original creator of this ChunkTicketManager.LoadingTicket. As such, the structure and particular data stored in the container is not concrete or defined in any specific way.

        Returns:
        The companion data in the form of a data container

      • setCompanionData

        void setCompanionData(DataContainer container)
        Sets the companion data for this loading ticket.

        The sort of data stored in the container is plugin/mod dependent and is based on the original creator of this ChunkTicketManager.LoadingTicket. As such, the structure and particular data stored in the container is not concrete or defined in any specific way.

        Parameters:
        container - The container containing the companion data

      • getPlugin

        String getPlugin()
        Gets the ID of the plugin that this ticket belongs to.
        Returns:
        The ID of the plugin that registered this ticket

      • getChunkList

        ImmutableSet<com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3i> getChunkList()
        Gets the set of chunks that are being force-loaded by this ticket.
        Returns:
        The set of force-loaded chunks

      • forceChunk

        void forceChunk(com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3i chunk)
        Force-loads a chunk using this ticket. If the configured concurrently loaded chunk limit is reached, the oldest loaded chunk will be removed.

        This does not cause an immediate load of the chunk. Forced chunks will be loaded eventually, but may not be available for a few ticks. Forced chunk loading is equivalent to the loading caused by a player.

        Parameters:
        chunk - The chunk to force-load

      • unforceChunk

        void unforceChunk(com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3i chunk)
        Removes a chunk from the force-loaded set of this ticket.
        Parameters:
        chunk - The chunk to remove from force-loading

      • prioritizeChunk

        void prioritizeChunk(com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3i chunk)
        Reorders a chunk to count as the 'newest' loaded chunk, making it the last chunk to be removed when adding more chunks for force-loading.
        Parameters:
        chunk - The chunk to reorder

      • release

        void release()
        Releases this ticket, removing all associated chunks and freeing up the ticket slot for later use by a new ticket.

        After this operation the ticket is invalid and cannot be used to force-load chunks.
